page.title: 07New Forest-Deer Research
page.content: There are deer platforms for observation in the main deer research area which is signposted. Here the public are asked to keep to the pathways. The Research involves studying the habits of deer. To the extreme north of this area in the{Denny Lodge Inclosure}there are deer pens for specific research for Fallow deer. This can involve feeding trials and repellant trials. The latter is to develop chemical sprays and repugnant smelling oils to put on trees. Otherwise deer can seriously damage trees in three ways: 1.{Browsing-}Deer eat shoots and buds. 2.{Fraying-}The males rub their antlers against the trees. 3.{Stripping-}In early spring deer strip and eat the bark. If this goes around the trunk the sap cannot rise and the tree dies.
